title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a crucial goal in the Bruins' 5-3 victory against his former team, the Toronto Maple Leafs.
Minten's goal was his third of the season and contributed to the Bruins' sixth consecutive win.
Coach Marco Sturm praised Minten as the best player on the ice after his impactful performance in Toronto.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was formally inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame during the weekend-long ceremony in Toronto.
Chara's legendary career includes a Stanley Cup win, seven All-Star selections, and a Norris Trophy victory.
Chara shared his Hall of Fame induction with fellow Bruin Joe Thornton, celebrating their achievements together.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox predicted to be active in free agency, targeting top free agents like Alex Bregman, Kyle Schwarber, and Pete Alonso.
Boston has $219 million committed in payroll, leaving $25 million below first luxury tax threshold for offseason signings.
Insiders see Red Sox as a strong fit for pitchers Dylan Cease and Framber Valdez, enhancing their rotation options.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, showcasing his 20-year music career.
Legend's setlist mainly featured songs from his debut album 'Get Lifted' but included other hits and covers.
The concert highlighted Legend's musical versatility, blending gospel, R&B, and pop elements in a two-hour show.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, mentioning a cold scoring fourth quarter.
Brown previously criticized officials after a Celtics' 105-103 loss to the Jazz, citing a missed foul call on Keyonte George.
Despite criticism, Brown wasn't fined for his remarks against the Jazz, but the league confirmed the missed foul call in its report.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield targets deep, with 1,919 yards, 13 touchdowns, and 98.1 passer rating despite receiver injuries.
Rookie receiver Emeka Egbuka, sidelined by a hamstring injury, has 562 yards and five touchdowns, key for Buccaneers' offense.
Buccaneers' defense, led by Vita Vea and Jamel Dean, ranks seventh in DVOA metrics, challenging for Patriots' offense.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game on CBS for the first time in over two years.
Nantz and Romo's return is seen as a sign of the Patriots' renewed relevance with quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel.
Nantz and Romo last called a Patriots game in Week 6 of the 2023 season, when Patriots lost to the Raiders.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost 123-110 to the Orlando Magic, marking their first defeat in the NBA Cup.
Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 32 points, but struggled from three-point range, going 1-for-6.
Orlando Magic's Franz Wagner scored 27 points and the Magic made 17 three-pointers, shooting 47.2% from deep.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand for creating appearance of impropriety in 2018 ICE-related incident.
A report found Judge Joseph unaware of escape plan but recommended reprimand for violating court rule on off-record discussion.
Charges against Judge Joseph were dropped in 2022 in exchange for state investigation referral after 2019 federal charges.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox were eliminated by the Yankees in the American League Wild Card Series, losing two games to one.
Shortstop Trevor Story opted in to his contract, while third baseman Alex Bregman opted out.
Manager Alex Cora reflects positively on the season, believing the team is on the right path for future success.
